pack.description.vibrancy.textures: Improved textures for use with Vibrancy
pack.description.vibrancy.ripple: An improved "rippling" effect for the enchantment glint
options.vibrancy.dynamic_lightmap.toolti: Tweaks the lighting colors based on player position. Ex: Light blue in a cold biome, yellow-tan in a desert biome, orange in the nether
options.vibrancy.raytrace_distance.toolt: The distance from camera where lights have perfect shadows, lights beyond this use an approximation
options.vibrancy.light_cull_distance.too: The distance from camera when lights are no longer displayed (for performance reasons)
options.vibrancy.transparency_test.toolt: Whether "transparent" blocks such as glass, doors, stairs, and grates should cast shadows
options.vibrancy.better_fog.tooltip: Improves underwater visibility, darkness and blindness effects, nether fog, etc.
options.vibrancy.elytra_trails.tooltip: White trails behind flying players, just like planes
options.vibrancy.max_raytraced_lights.to: A cap on the number of raytraced lights, avoiding lag
options.vibrancy.max_shadow_distance.too: Skips the shadows of blocks if they are greater than this value away from the light source
options.vibrancy.max_light_radius.toolti: Maximum blocks a dynamic light can extend (from center)
screen.vibrancy.alpha.title:
Thank you for using Vibrancy!

This mod is still a work-in-progress, and the raytraced shadows §emay flicker§r a little in certain cases. Expect lag. Some quality was sacrificed for this to be playable, and the shadows §emight not always look correct§r. These are §eknown issues§r, so please don't waste time reporting them. Any suggestions from fellow coders on how to optimize the raytracing will be greatly appreciated. You can tweak cap values for lights in the video options, they are currently set to what worked best on my computer.
